page.title: 13THE HERITAGE FAYRE CLITHEROE
page.content: The Heritage Fayre is a festival that takes place on a Sunday, once every year. All roads into the town centre are closed to traffic so that it is an advantage to be living near the centre. Over a hundred stalls are set up by the roadside while in the middle people are everywhere. The Fayre attracts not only the local people but people from all over Lancashire. The owners of the stalls shout, ring bells, use megaphones and do all kinds of things to advertise themselves and to attract attention. It is not all stalls though. Other events are held in the castle grounds. This year there were trips in a hot air balloon. This was Clitheroe's second annual Heritage Fayre and it raised Â£25,000 for charities.
